remarks: The Konigsberg Bridge problem.  If ` <. V , E >. ` is the graph on four vertices ` 0 , 1 , 2 , 3 ` , with edges ` { 0 , 1 } , { 0 , 2 } , ` ` { 0 , 3 } , { 1 , 2 } , { 1 , 2 } , { 2 , 3 } , { 2 , 3 } ` , then vertices ` 0 , 1 , 3 ` each have degree three, and ` 2 ` has degree five, so there are four vertices of odd degree and thus by ~ eupath the graph cannot have an Eulerian path.  This is Metamath 100 proof #54. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Mar-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Feb-2016.)
